posts.description: Beach supper at our little bolthole in the wood. Before the weather changes & we are back to school tomorrow. #ourwild #ireland #beach #hiddenireland #cookingwithfire

Heartbroken üíî. Libby joined our family in July of 2015. We rescued her from dreadful living circumstances and she was very nervous & skittish for the first few months. But, she got on great with Ted, and soon became the most loving and affectionate pup any of us here had ever encountered. Libby would literally jump into Richard's arms every evening when he arrived home from the farm and proceed to lick his face to bits. She was Geoffrey's sleeping buddy/monster protector each night, and was always by my side during the day. Libby was happy, healthy, and totally full of energy- every. single. day. When she became ill last weekend we never imagined it would lead to her demise. After several vet appts, and then emergency surgery, she seemed to be doing well post-op, but then there was a complication and we lost her overnight. We are stunned and so very, very sad. Rest in peace sweet, sweet Libby, we loved you so much. üôèüèºüíï

{üì∑ by @nathaliemc} Great things never came from comfort zones. When @notoriouspsgie + @canonuk invited me to come and do a little talk on food photography in Dublin today, I must admit, it put me in a little dither. Despite photographing a cookbook, shooting professional assignments for many publications & learning from the best at our #lensandlarder retreats, standing in front of an audience imparting food photography knowledge seemed out of my comfort zone. But, I came and conquered and, best of all, when @nathaliemc posted this beautiful moody photo of @frenchfoodieindublin (holding a pretty pink @westindublin macaron) and explained that she felt inspired by my presentation to go out of her own comfort zone, I felt tremendously gratified. Thank you Nathalie, what a gorgeous photograph. And, thank you again @ornyd & Canon team and everyone who came along. (PS, y'all need to follow this sweet lady...she has such a masterful eye and has long been an inspiration to me too. #canonfoodiephotos
Sunday Eggs. Down & Durty Style. Recipe in #thefarmettecookbook

I'd like to say a word about this amazing human, @davidprior. David partnered with @ditteisager for our #lensandlarder workshop in Connemara last week, after spending a handful of breathtaking, intrepid weeks in India hosting a large group of dynamic guests for his very enterprising maiden @prior.knowledge voyage (check the sensational feed!). He graciously recorded the best "hello" vid for our participants from the exotic backwaters of Kerala and hopped a jet to Ireland shortly thereafter. When I collected David at the Galway train station, I presumed he'd be exhausted and wanting to rest, but he was full of zest, and colour, and fascinating stories, and loads of good cheer. David brought so much to this workshop, sharing with our participants, as a seasoned travel writer, many of his extraordinary travel narratives, and  then how to blend together the food and soul of the West of Ireland. I hope everyone walked away feeling just as inspired by his generosity, teaching, and warmth at @lensandlarder as @cliodhnaprendergast and I did. Thank you, David, in awe + gratitude. üôèüèºüí´

Whistle-stop journey up & down to Dublin today to visit the US Embassy for Geoffrey's passport renewal (passport party in #stories ‚òùüèº) Have always loved Ballsbridge which is sort of a funny name (who knows the history?), but filled with beautiful Georgian walk-ups that remind me a little bit of my old Brooklyn neighbourhood. PS. Sorry if this is your house!! #nostalgia #brooklyn #ballsbridge #dublin #expat #american #ireland #passport #livingabroad #iphoneography

Me + @ditteisager's sweet baby Roxy in @cliodhnaprendergast's stunning light-filled home (wrapped in @thetweedproject) during Ditte's #lensandlarder lighting discussion-very apt. (Gorgeous üì∑ by @besterlanda @sixdutchessfarm thank you Hans.)
Back at the farm. Annnnnd, breathe. (little story above)

A special #lensandlarder teaching moment with @ditteisager at @ballynahinchcastle. Stinging Nettle +Wild Garlic + Vetch soup blend by way of our farm garnished with @cliodhnaprendergast's Connemara foraged three-cornered leek flowers in beautiful @helenjamesdesign pottery. Unforgettable week for @lensandlarder; between Ditte's mastery and @davidprior expert travel storytelling and all of our incredible and enthusiastic participants: @cannellevanille @popejoys @thejenchase @nicole_beck_photography @spookymadsen @salyenia @juliehelfrich @sixdutchessfarm @besterlanda @oneligan @cornershopproductions @jomurphyphotographer @_marinadenisova_ @sbr2photography @janet__ogrady @takingamomentintime and the generous hospitality and assistance of Patrick O'Flaherty, @ardbia, @kylemoreabbey, @killaryfjordshellfish, @scubadive_west, @nicholasmossepottery, @thetweedproject, Christian, Wilder + Roxy!! Profound thanks to all üôèüèºüí´üñ§.
